name: unliberated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
following traditional ways of behaving or old ideas: He was very old-fashioned and held views that were distinctly unliberated. These are ideas that our unliberated grandmothers would struggle to grasp.
More examplesFewer examplesWhen I think back to my first job, I realize how unliberated the company was, with women almost exclusively performing administrative tasks.She found it an incredibly unliberated concept that she had to take her husband's name when she got married. Although women are emancipated in the country, the society is still essentially an unliberated one.
